title: Johnson City and Its Environs
name: Johnson City and Its Environs
description:
A Map by Critregionalism

A sketch of the map to accompany my forthcoming book from University of North Carolina Press.

properties.name: Bumpass (or Bumpus) Cove
properties.description: Posted by CritregionalismScene of 1979-1981 collaborative action by local residents in opposition to toxic waste dumping by Waste Management International. (See Chapter Two.)

properties.name: East Tennessee State University
properties.description: Posted by CritregionalismRegional comprehensive university, founded in 1911 as the State Normal School. (See Chapter Five.)

properties.name: Erwin, Tennessee
properties.description: Posted by CritregionalismSite of 1916 hanging of "Murderous Mary," a circus elephant. (See Introduction.)

properties.name: Home of Emma Hawk
properties.description: Posted by Critregionalism104 Brentwood Drive, Johnson City, TN104 Brentwood Drive, where authorities maintain Howard Hawk Willis killed Adam Chrismer and Samantha Leming in October 2002. (See Chapter Three.)

properties.name: Iris Glen Environmental Center
properties.description: Posted by CritregionalismLandfill operated by Browning-Ferris International. (See Chapter Two.)

properties.name: Scholar Holler
properties.description: Posted by CritregionalismSeminole Woods subdivision, developed in the mid-1960\'s; home of many ETSU faculty and administrators. (See Chapters One and Five.)

properties.name: Winged Deer Park
properties.description: Posted by CritregionalismWinged Deer ParkCurrent location of Massengill statue commemorating early landowner, and Robert Young home, one of Johnson City\'s oldest man-made structures. (See Chapter Two.) Also the site where remains of Adam Chrismer were found by fishermen, leading to arrest of Howard Hawk Willis. (See Chapter Three.)
